title: Difficult Behaviour
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Child care
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Child development
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Child care
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Child care
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Child development
description: Episode of Series "PGR Series". Examines how difficult behaviour can be defined in terms of a child's development. Can a baby's behaviour be called difficult? The "terrible two's" is this a myth or a reality? PGR also suggests strategies that parents can use in coming to terms with any child's difficult behaviour. The roles of childcare workers, counsellors and play are also explored.
